author: David Swan
title: Energy firm launches Redback smart solar solution
text:
Australian energy storage provider Redback Technologies has launched its new Internet of Things energy solution, the Redback Smart Hybrid System.
The device, which runs on Microsoft’s Azure platform, has hybrid technology that manages and stores solar energy, allowing users to either save it for their own personal use or sell it back to the grid.
The system collects data about home energy through a Raspberry Pi computer running a Windows 10 core IoT operating system to compare home energy usage against optimum performance levels and the diagnose potential service failures.
“That’s pretty appealing for solar customers, because if their system goes down then they’re no longer gaining any value from it,” Paul Liddell, Redback Technologies CIO said.
“So being able to provide preventative maintenance and have an issue fixed before the customer knowing about it is a pretty huge deal for both us and our partners.”
Phil Livingston, Redback Technologies’ Managing Director, said he valued his firm's partnership with tech giant Microsoft.
“This partnership is evolving. Microsoft’s guidance and support has aided Redback significantly in the process of delivering innovation to market,” he said.
"The future of energy intranet, the future of Internet of Things, the future of energy storage and of distributed generation - is a marriage of all of these technologies into one."
The device has an adjustable b attery capacity of 100 to 10,000 Amp-Hours, and boasts a maximum efficiency (to utility grid) of 97.6 per cent.
Mr Livinsgstone said the Smart Hybrid System would be available at Sonepar (L&H Group)’s 180 wholesale locations around Australia and solar panel installers can pre order today with devices available next month.
He said pricing of the devices and installation will depend the individual’s roof size and aspect so pricing will vary.
As reported in The Australian last month Microsoft has just released its Azure Internet of Things suite to the general public, allowing customers to use preconfigured data and machine learning solutions to better run their businesses.
